title: Crits are bad for the game?!
body:
I came across this clip of Doublelift arguing about critical strikes after killing someone he says he should of died against. And it really made me open my eyes about it. I have come across to the realization that critical chance is actually kind of bad for the game. It makes the game inconsistent and instead of fair balanced battles, its more of will you get lucky enough to get that crit to kill an enemy opposed to actual skill required. Lets say I am in a 1v1 battle adc and adc we both have the same items and the same critical chance but he ends up get one more crit then I do, ends up completely killing me due to that crit with no real skill involved in it I also could go all day with examples. The critical chance adds too much randomness in the game. But how would Riot replace it for ADCs to do a decent amount of damage and does Riot or the people even care is why I posted this here. I have a couple of suggestions such as nerfing armor or giving ADs more AD for less gold but I would think that champs such as Zed and talon would go off the roof in superiority. But what do you guys think
EDIT: If you vote no and downvote this thread want to explain why?

replies.body:
Crits are literally no different than dodge was. Think of it this way:

10% Dodge = 10% chance to reduce damage by 100%
10% Crit = 10% chance to increase damage by 100%

Crits are literally the inverse of dodge. If dodge was bad for the game, then crits are, de facto, bad for the game.

Dodge never felt good. Crit feels good. Dodge just felt like invisible armor. Crits feel like a massive spike in power and are heavily iconic. It might make sense to remove RNG but it would make the game feel a lot worse and it would also call for at least 40 reworks.

Dodge was fairly simple to remove and mostly had a positive effect on the game. It probably shouldn't have existed in the first place.
Dodge felt good **for the person dodging**. Crits feel good **for the person critting**. Neither one feels good for the opponent suffering them.
Yes, the same thing can be said about all the CC in the game. We have that, don't we?
Except that CC is tied to abilities, not RNG or Pseudo-RNG.

Dunno, i feel bad if i crit an opponent to dead with a 30sth%chance aswell as i feel bad when i don´t crit despite having 75%crit. It´s much more satisfying to just outplay an opponent without relaying on Crit-RNG at all for me.

> [{quoted}](name=Don Eulrich,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hbbBqQmH,comment-id=000300030000,timestamp=2014-12-19T16:30:03.537+0000)
>

But the replacement for Crit would basically just be a pseudo Vayne passive or basically just an Udyr Q passive where you deal increased damage per auto. Thats the only real way they could change Crit entirely.
There are lots of ideas already going around in this Boards to replace Crit with a RNG-independent- scaling-factor. Wouldn´t be a big problem.
A pseudo Vayne passive would be a great change. Crit replaced with bonus damage for consecutive autos against the same target? Sounds **awesome**.
That way well placed cc to reset that stack would be a genunine outplay which adds strategy lol. I think that would work.

Not entirely.  
Crit is only Psuedo RNG, for every attack you crit you become less likely to crit and every attack you dont crit increases the likelyhood of criting on your next auto. This was to reduce scenarios where ADCs would crit like 6 times in a row or not crit for like 10 autos.  
This said, I agree that it needs to changed with the suggested reddit change of increasing damage by a % per auto up to a cap, with IE increasing that cap.

Well, dodge could also work that way.
Also, But, think of a different scenario.
Think about a dodge that works exactly like crit but reduces damage taken from autoattacks of 50%.
How would you feel when you see a crit animation, and yet you see the enemy reducing the damage of your IE crit from 250% to 125% due to dodge?
And what if he manages to win the teamfight thanks to that trade?

a chance to avoid damage all together and a chance to deal bonus damage, are both completely different things.  
If it were a chance to reduce damage taken from auto attacks by 25% then it would be a better comparison between crit and dodge, especially since % reduction is more powerful than % bonus( 100 - 25% = 75. 75 + 25% is 93.75.)  
Dodge is just inherently broken since its a chance to become significantly more tanky, not to mention reducing the amount the enemy can lifesteal off you and having the ability to dodge on-hit effects.  
Meanwhile Crit is actually pretty balanced.  It's a damage multiplier off of your own AD, when you build it, it is both implied and recommended that you primarily basic attack the enemy. While Dodge doesnt care what you do, you can auto attack, tank, afk, retreat and you are ALWAYS benefiting from it.
It´s even worse...with IE you increase the dmg by more than 100% - it´s like dodging would heal you on top of taking no dmg.

Somehow, in season 1, the community argued that the counter to crit is armor, and that dodge has no counter which makes them different.

yeah these people are the ones who have been controlling the balance of this game since S1.
mh, hadn´t there been arguments for AS countering Dodge aswell?

Crits only affect auto attack except in a few skill exceptions, Dodge only affected auto attacks as well... The obvious counter to dodge was skill damage, mages and attack damage bursters.

They could have made a few extra adjustments to make skill proc auto attacks and sheen charges always hit, or made dodge into a damage reduction effect similar to crit, but the real truth is that Riot has been nerfing defensive options into the dirt for ages now, virtually every item with defense or healing has been nerfed in defense or made less cost efficient through cost or reduction in other stats, as well as a reduction in map defense. Eliminating dodge on phantom dance was the deciding blow that ushered in marksman dominance, along with more AD empowered skills in their kits.

Ultimately the loss of dodge was just another victim of unhealthy Esports engineering. Don't buy Riots explanations at face value, they just say stuff to pretend to sympathize when their clearly disappointing their community.
yeah but Riot's official stance on it was that crit is mitigated by armor where as AS didnt inherently affect dodge.

well, guess they won´t try that excuse again...at least they seem aware of the issue in general as FeralPony hinted: 

>Discussion Topics on Contentious Issues - Seeing people propose specific solutions for issues and the response to those solutions is really valuable. A specific example here would be the Critical Strike or Grievous Wounds discussions that pop up from time to time. Even if the issues discussed aren't ones we are working on right this minute the discussions are still valuable to have so we can make progress faster on them when we start working on changes.
(http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/QL6FKEGE-a-sincere-question-for-the-reds?comment=0006)

though they still seem unwilling to take action on the issue, unfortunatelly.

But why was dodge removed in the first place???

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=19884039

I mean other than jax dodging fountain laser.

People seem to have long been against crit being removed.

Yes, they should be removed.

It would help the AD carry roster alot, would force Riot to change ADCs in more interesting ways and would diversify the ADCs way more.

Got any suggestions for how they might diversify the carries more? Some are built around the idea of crit, like Draven and Caitlyn. Others are not, like Ezreal and Corki. Removal of crit needs to have some sort of replacement that would help carries that needed it, while not overly benefiting Assassins like Zed and Talon who also auto-attack frequently. 

Some of the diversity can be fixed up by giving alternate build paths. You just know Koggy could potentially feel right at home with an expanded-upon and well thought out on-hit build path, as could Teemo. 

Though, I still agree that crit should go by the wayside, we can't remove it without some form of compensation for those who relied on it.

Who not rework critical hit into bonus autoattack damage.

As in 1% of crit is 1% of bonus autoattack damage. The average damage will stay the same, but it won't be random anymore. IE obviously would increase all bonus autoattack damage by 50%. Obviously the bonus damage wouldn't work on turrets.

I mean, this is the simplest way of removing randomness from the game and I am sure it was proposed many times. I don't know why it wasn't implemented yet, as I don't see any major flaws to it.
The only issue is having to face the backlash for about a month or two.

well, with the Lore-retcon they didn´t care about the major backlash at all - so why stop there?
Unlike the Retcon this Change would be direly needed for the health of the game.
Yes, I agree.

If you do that, you massively buff Zed and Talon especially. Zed in particular walks a fine line between balanced and unbalanced. This would allow Youmuu's, by your idea, to give him straight up 15% more auto-attack damage or so.  Then you get the Talons who occasionally buy Infinity Edge for more burst - you just gave him that 50% more auto-attack damage, on top of the 80 AD it gave him anyway. They haven't implemented that idea arguably benefits assassins MORE than it benefits AD Carries. You just incentivized crit for assassins.

The reason they haven't implemented that idea is because it is extremely short-sighted and takes away the randomness from carries without properly thinking about its effects for the broader spectrum of AD-using champions.

> [{quoted}](name=Anidan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hbbBqQmH,comment-id=0000000000000002,timestamp=2014-12-19T21:27:16.963+0000)
>
> If you do that, you massively buff Zed and Talon especially. Zed in particular walks a fine line between balanced and unbalanced. This would allow Youmuu's, by your idea, to give him straight up 15% more auto-attack damage or so.  Then you get the Talons who occasionally buy Infinity Edge for more burst - you just gave him that 50% more auto-attack damage, on top of the 80 AD it gave him anyway. They haven't implemented that idea arguably benefits assassins MORE than it benefits AD Carries. You just incentivized crit for assassins.
> 
> The reason they haven't implemented that idea is because it is extremely short-sighted and takes away the randomness from carries without properly thinking about its effects for the broader spectrum of AD-using champions.

I don't understand the thought process of people like you. 

200 + 100 damage is the same as 150 + 150.

What? That has nothing to do with anything I said. It removes the randomness and therefore gives Assassins reasons to WANT crit. Rather than a chance at larger burst, they can buy Infinity Edge and be guaranteed a huge amount of extra damage for not wanting randomness. The randomness is what keeps some assassins from buying crit consistently. Make it guaranteed damage and they'll take it because it's now reliable burst. 

I'm not saying "Don't remove crit," I'm saying "find a compensation that benefits AD Carries but doesn't give Assassins incentive to buy it just as much"

Okay, let's say Zed has a crit chance of 15%, 100 AD and hits the enemy three times during his combo.

With the current system, the assassination *could* look something like this:
200 + 100 + 100 = 400
*or*
200 + 200 + 200 = 600
*or*
100 + 200 + 200 = 500
*or*
100 + 100 + 100 = 300
*or...*
Those are very inconsistent numbers, but the average amount of damage dealt is 345, assuming you perform infinite assassinations.

But if crit chance increased AA damage by a set amount, it would look like this *100% of the time:*
115 + 115 + 115 = 345
This will add consistency and clarity. You *will* know how much damage the enemy will deal. 

>The randomness is what keeps some assassins from buying crit consistently.

Compared to the current system, this would actually lower their damage output, assuming they landed at least one crit (400+ -> 345).

And of Talon who will gain a consistent 50%? Or Zed, if he so chooses to buy that same item? Their damage is more consistent, but that consistency is a *boon* to them. the inconsistency (and high AD) is what kept it a luxury item to buy only when ahead, never as a core item because they -could- go way above the expected damage, or way below it. You wanted stability for their burst - you wanted to know the exact numbers you could get ahead of time just as much as they did. This does give clarity, but again it helps the assassins more than it helps the carries. Now the assassin can reliably blow them up much, much faster. 

Zed or Talon with a passive 60% or so more auto-attack damage if he buys both when ahead sounds like it wouldn't be too bad compared to a potentially larger random increase, but that is now 60% more than they can reliably kill you with, that you will lack any meangingful counterplay to. A Zed can routinely have 300+ AD, easily by end-game. Not only that, he double-dips into that damage with his W passive increasing his AD. A Zed that can reliably do 450+ damage on auto-attacks, in addition to his ability burst, would be overbearing at the absolute least. Now is it more reliable? Yes. Does it convey more clarity? Yes. But we BOTH know they could find a much better method that didn't make AD Assassins overbearing at the same time, for the sake of clarity. Making it do % AA damage is a lazy band-aid at best, one that Zed will pick at and make sure the wound continues to bleed.

Follow your own advice and re-read what I just wrote:

>Compared to the current system, this would actually lower their damage output, assuming they landed at least one crit (400+ -> 345).

The change wouldn't affect assassins as much as you think. The current crit system has a higher potential damage output during **short** fights than the proposed new system. 

During **prolonged** fights, the numbers of the two systems will even out.

Assassins won't be sitting there, AAing the enemy twenty times. Their damage is focused on quick burst. 
ADCs on the other hand are very likely to attack the enemy with basic attacks a lot of times during a fight. Their damage will roughly stay the same, thanks to the increased number of attacks (trials).

Remember: You have to walk on eggshells when it comes to balancing AD Assassins and AD Carries. This change doesn't seem like it's as big a deal to you, but I guarantee it is. Zed, even without as much crit, already walks a fine line on the "balanced" spectrum. Allow Infinity Edge to enter his build as a damage item reliably, and he'll hurdle that line. That reliable 60% damage immediately for him greatly benefits his ult at all times, whereas crit didn't. 

But if they implement this change and suddenly Zed has to be nerfed because he will be an outlier for this, I guarantee you, you had a lazy change to thank. 

Crit needs to be gone, but it needs a much more well-thought out system than this.

>That reliable **60% damage** immediately for him greatly benefits his ult at all times, whereas crit didn't. 

Mind to explain where you are getting that number from? 

Currently, IE has 25% crit chance (soon to be 20%) and increases critical damage by 50%. Assuming Zed has 100 AD, this would result in 137.5 damage per AA.

On live, that value is either 100 or 250. That's a potential damage loss of 39%. 

**Edit:** Are you talking about GB + IE? The new system would result in a potential damage loss of 29%.

GB + IE, which come to think of it, could be a larger percent than 60% because of IE's crit bonus damage maybe resulting in 70-80%, because GB gives him the attack speed for more auto-attacks, plus penetration he'll need. Conversely, instead of looking at the loss, you look at the consistent gain. He could lose that 250 damage, yes, but he'll also never hit lower than 160-180 ever again. That's a gain that equalizes the loss, something that Zed would gladly take over random burst he has no control over.

>That's a gain that equalizes the loss, something that Zed would gladly take over random burst he has no control over.

But that's the entire point of the new system? 

But I just remembered the way they un-randomized madreds's razor. Instead of using the average bonus damage, they shaved off ~10% or so because the bonus damage was more consistent now.
Maybe that would be a good solution, too. Consistent AA damage increase at the cost of ~10% lower bonus AA damage?

Perhaps. Something that could limit it for people using it for burst (Zed) but not so much for someone who is using it consistently (AD Carries). With Zed getting up to 80% more auto-attack damage with just IE + GB, that wouldn't fly over too well. But if you reduce it somehow for them, it would work much better for sustained damage, and much worse for burst. The goal of crit is more to multiply auto-attack damage in a sustained encounter (it being great for skirmishes was a side-effect of the RNG, and again, I agree that it needs removed) so that tanks didn't become unstoppable juggernauts and immovable objects to almost everyone, in addition to Armor Pen, at least, that was my understanding of its use, since it has no effect on turrets, for instance. 

The difficult part is not in realizing that the RNG needs to go, but in balancing the now-stable damage between assassins and carries. Zed auto-attacks frequently, even for his burst, so that needs to be reined in somehow or he'll pop people even more reliably. On the other hand, AD Carries need the damage consistently over the span of the fight. That's the difficulty with just making it into a straight %, otherwise I'd have no problem with that.
Congrats, you just gave a massive buff to every AD-ratio scaling champion (Zed, Ez, Talon, etc.)
How? Their abilities scale with AD. He is suggesting that crit should increase AA damage by a set amount, instead of relying on RNG.

The only champion I would even care about losing crit for would be yasuo for obvious reasons and when playing him crit isnt even crit anyways (what I mean is you have 100% usually)

I think Infinity Edge could just become like rabbadons like +10% bonus ad, keeping in like the differences between ad/ap amounts). Crit on everything else just replaced with more of whatever it already had.
ad-bonus would be a really bad idea, as you would have to rebalance all AD-Casters then.

Even if we totally ignore nonsense like 1% Crit chance from Runes, it's still bad for the game for a number of reasons.  The randomness is a big part of it, but the major reason is the fact that auto-attacks have too *much* scaling.  It causes Rangers to be largely interchangeable with each other since *the* most important part of their kit is nothing more than a heap of items.

There are two ways to address this.  One would be to make Crit grant percentile damage bonus on auto-attacks.  This would closely mimic the system we have now, just without the variance.  And most importantly, without the 1% crit chance cheese.

The other would be to turn Whisper and Voidstaff into flat penetration items and then change 'Crit Chance' into 'Piercing'.  Basically, you would be buying percentile penetration for your auto-attacks so that Rangers can still quickly chew through hard targets without turning soft ones into a fine red mist.  This would effectively remove two layers of auto-attack damage amplification from the game (crit chance and crit damage) and allow Ranger kits to be buffed and diversified so that they're something healthier than 'hurdur rightclick and use your dash if someone gets close'.

And I suspect both Ashe and Try would be able to keep their in-kit Crit chance.  Ashe's is the *opposite* of random and Try's would give him a neat tool that no one else has.

Ashe, Tryn, and as much as i hate it, possibly Critplank should be allowed to keep crit, just reworked - Like Jax and dodge. And just another kick in the pants to sivir - lost dodge, now you lose crit. poor sivir.

Edit - Yasuo would have to be changed too - not a bad thing, but i suppose theoretically he'd get it as part of a reworked passive or something.
Thematically though, why does he have that passive to begin with?

> [{quoted}](name=rinsujo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hbbBqQmH,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2014-12-19T21:17:21.045+0000)
>
> Ashe, Tryn, and as much as i hate it, possibly Critplank should be allowed to keep crit, just reworked - Like Jax and dodge. And just another kick in the pants to sivir - lost dodge, now you lose crit. poor sivir.

Critplank will no longer rely on randomness. He will still deal the same amount of damage on average.

Same goes for Ashe and Tryn. Ashe gains a free 2x damage shot with her passive and Tryn builds bonus AA damage over time. 

This is no different for Yasuo. 10% crit chance would equal to +20% AA damage (minus the % penalty).

It should be changed so that if you have 33 percent, you WILL crit every three autos...instead of pure luck. Then, it would take skills, to auto minions first and use the auto that would crit on champions...
Too easily abused.

I think if it was more of guaranteed every three hits but no more than three.

You don't get a visual counter, and can have it none tracked as you could crit on the second or first hit.

I think LIMITED RNG is a step in the right direction until it gets reworked

Riot dug a hole for themselves when they wanted RNG removed from the game yet Critical Strikes are integral, as of current, to marksmen's power scaling into late game. 

If dodge was gone, so should Critical Hits.

Critical Hits are not a broken mechanic, such is present in nearly every video game ever made involving attacks. It adds a hail Mary kind of situation when they occur, and that can lead to fun times in games, because the unexpected just makes for something far more interesting than numbers against numbers. 
With that being said, most other games with Critical Hit rarely have the capacity to jack it above 50%, and very rarely allow the stat to be increased by increments larger than 10% at a time, and that's usually considered high for the stat. With items in LoL increasing it by 20-25% at a time, and absurd champions *COUGH*YASUO*COUGH* who downright have a built in abuse of the stat, the stat will naturally feel toxic. This can easily be fixed by lowering how much crit is granted by items, or simply giving an overall cap limit to it, similar to how CDR has a cap. Characters like Ashe can keep their passive because a one shot crit isn't going to be game breaking. But characters stacking excess of 50%-60% crit and using it to deal massive damage with next to no retaliation are a problem.

>Critical Hits are not a broken mechanic, such is present in nearly every video game ever made involving attacks.

There´s a huge difference between Crit/RNG in a PvE-Environment and a competetive setting. RNG is totally fine if it only affects the player himself (or for the sake of MMOs affects fights that last >2min, so it eventually will even out on the numbers) - but it´s highly frustrating if you win a duel/game just by "using a 25% chance better".
